instruction:
*Hibiscus Simple Syrup:
1:1 w/ a cup of dried hibiscus steeping for 30-40 min

*House-made Cranberry syrup: 
-- 2 cups Fresh Cranberries
-- 1 cup Sugar
-- 1 cup Water
-- 2 Bay Leaves
-- .25 cup Pink Peppercorns
-- Half Serrano Chile
-- 4 Sprigs Fresh Rosemary

Add all ingredients to a pot and heat thoroughly. Simmer on low until cranberries cook down for 25 minutes. Strain and let cool.

*Pineapple Gomme: 
Mix equal parts (1.5 cups) gum arabic with water over high heat until it all mixes and then let cool for a bit. Then you're gonna make a sugar syrup with 2 parts sugar, 1 part water (4 cups water, 2 cups white granulated sugar) in the same manner over high heat until it mixes, and then add the gum syrup to the mix until everything dissolves and what you're left with is a thick gummy syrup that resembles a whole lot of baby batter. Then cut up 1.5 cups of pineapple chunks, put in mason jar, and pour the gum syrup over it and let it sit in the refrigerator over night. A few hours would work also if you don't have that much time. However, the more time, the more pineapple infusion takes place. When it's ready, strain into another mason jar or bottle, and it's ready to go.
*Pineapple Syrup: Equal parts pineapple blended with water and sugar and strained

1st glass ingredients:
Luxardo Maraschino, Acid Phosphate

2nd glass ingredients:
BarSol Quebranta Pisco, Luxardo Amaro Abano, Luxardo Fernet, Scrappy's Aromatic Bitters

Add 6-8 sugar snap peas to cocktail shaker. Lightly muddle the peas. Add all other ingredients except for the tonic. Shake and double strain into a collins glass. Top with tonic. 

*House-made Simple Syrup: 
-- 1 cup Sugar
-- 1 cup Water

Add equal parts sugar and water into a small saucepan, bring to a boil; simmer until the sugar is dissolved, approximately 3 minutes. Remove from heat, let cool to room temperature and transfer to a clean glass jar. Cover and keep refrigerated for up to 2 weeks.
Add all ingredients and dry-shake (without ice), then add ice, and shake again. Strain into coupe and garnish with rhubarb bitters.
Add all ingredients except beer into shaker tin, shake vigorously for 10 seconds. Add beer in shaker tin then double strain into tin cup. Add mint for garish.
Add all ingredients except the champagne to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir, and strain into a martini glass. Fill with champagne and garnish with a flamed orange peel.
Add all ingredients except the whip cream and ginger snap. Shake and double into a rocks glass with no ice. Top with marshmallow whip cream. Garnish with Ginger snap crumbles.

Add all ingredients in a cocktail shaker, shake, fine strain into a chilled coupe or martini glass. Garnish with edible flower.

*Jasmine Tea/Rice-Infused Junipero Gin:
-- 1 bottle (750ml) Junípero gin
-- .5 cup Jasmine Tea
-- .5 cup Jasmine Rice (wash rice to eliminate starch)

Sous Vide Version: Wash the jasmine rice to clean out the starch. Fill container with hot water. Set sous vide at 52c. Add vacuum seal bag with jasmine tea/rice in bath. Let sit in bath for 45 minutes. Take the bag out of bath and sit it in ice bath for 15 minutes. Open bag and fine strain back into bottle.

Infusion Version: Wash the jasmine rice to clean out the starch. In a cambro/mason jar, add Junípero gin and jasmine tea and rice. Let infuse for 24 hours. Fine strain into bottle.

**House-made Honey Syrup: 

Put equal parts of honey (10 oz) and water (10 oz) in a saucepan. Boil, then turn down to a simmer and stir until the honey is completely dissolved.
Add all ingredients in a mixing glass and stir with ice. Strain into a Nick & Nora coupe. Garnish with a ghost orange twist.
Add all ingredients in a mixing glass with fresh ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a Nick & Nora glass. Garnish with lime pinwheel and bing cherry.
Add all ingredients in a mixing glass with fresh ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a Nick & Nora glass. Garnish with lime pinwheel and bing cherry.
Add all ingredients in a mixing glass with fresh ice. Shake vigorously and strain into a Nick & Nora glass. Garnish with orange slice and 1 bar spoon juniper berries.
Add all ingredients in a mixing glass with fresh ice. Shake vigorously and strain over fresh ice. Garnish with Luxardo Cherry.
Add all ingredients in mixing glass, stir and strain over 2x2 ice cube in smoked glass on hickory board. Garnish with orange peel and clothes pin.
Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker. Shake and double strain into a glass. Garnish with a sprig of mint.
Add all ingredients into a punch bowl or pitcher and stir. Add lemon wheels and strawberries to garnish.
Add all ingredients into a punch bowl. Serve in small rocks glasses.
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice, shake furiously. Fine strain into chilled coupe. Garnish with a lemon twist.
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake. Strain over fresh ice into a rocks glass. Garnish with star anise and two slices lemongrass.
Add all ingredients into a shaker, shake strain into a collins glass, fill with crushed ice, garnish with mint leaves.
Add all ingredients into shaking tin. Add ice cubes to tin. Shake vigorously and strain into coupe. Garnish with Luxardo Maraschino Cherry.
Add all ingredients over ice. Stir with a barspoon. Squeeze lemon wedges and add blackberries.
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass and stir for 15-20 seconds. Strain into a highball filled with fresh ice.
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass filled with ice. Stir until cold and strain into a chilled coupe.
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass. Add ice and integration shake. Pour over fresh ice into a highball and top with California Lager. Garnish with a half orange wheel.
Add all ingredients to a mixing glass. Stir until thoroughly chilled (~30 seconds). Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Serve with one big rock. Garnish with an expressed orange swath.
Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake vigorously and strain into chilled stemmed cordial glass. Garnish with cocktail cherry and lemon twist.
Add all ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake, and strain into a chilled coupe glass.

Add all ingredients to a shaker and shake well without ice to emulsify the egg white. Add ice and shake hard until the drink is chilled. Strain through a fine-mesh strainer into a chilled coupe and garnish.
Add all ingredients to a shaker and shake with ice, then double strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a celery leaf.
Add all ingredients to a shaker, add ice, shake and strain into a martini glass garnish with a Luxardo Cherry.
Add all ingredients to blender and blend throughly. Double strain into a glass with cracked ice garnish with a mint sprig and fresh grated nutmeg.

Add all ingredients to tin and dry shake. Add ice and vigorously shake for 12 seconds. Fine strain into chilled cocktail glass. Garnish by sprinkling matcha powder (.25 tsp). 

*Rich Simple Syrup: 
-- 2 cups Granulated Sugar
-- 1 cup Water

Combine sugar and water in a small saucepan over medium heat and stir until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat, let cool to room temperature and transfer to a clean glass jar. Cover and keep refrigerated for up to 2 weeks.
Add all ingredients together.
Add all liquid ingredients into a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into an ice filled white wine glass. Garnish by adding pineapple chunks and Luxardo Cherry.

Add all of the ingredients, except seeds, to a shaker with ice and shake well. Double strain onto fresh ice into a collins glass. Garnish with 1 spoon of passion fruit seeds.

*Pilon Syrup:
Homemade 50/50 simple syrup using Pilon Sugar made from Mexican Sugar Cane.
Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir until well chilled and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a flamed orange twist.
Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir, and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a Luxardo Cherry.
Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir, and strain into a cocktail glass. Garnish with a slice of orange peel.
Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir, and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with an apple slice.
Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir, and strain into a small wine or cocktail glass. Twist a slice of lemon peel over the drink and use as garnish.
Add all the ingredients to a mixing glass and fill with ice. Stir, and strain into an old fashioned glass filled with fresh ice. Garnish with a Luxardo Cherry and an orange slice or twist.
Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake, and strain into a chilled coupe glass filled with crushed ice.

Add all the ingredients to a shaker and fill with ice. Shake, and strain into a coupe glass.

*Pineapple-Infused Mezcal:
Peel, core and chop a whole pineapple into 1-inch cubes. Add to a large jar or other container with a lid, and add a 750-mL bottle of mezcal. Let stand for 5 days and strain before using.

Add cognac, amaro, lemon, strawberry syrup and fresh cracked egg white of a whole egg to tin. Dry shake without ice approx. 5 seconds to emulsify. Add ice and shake hard again approx. 10 seconds. Fine strain into coupe. Crack drag black pepper over surface. Serve and enjoy.

*Strawberry syrup- 1 cup fresh strawberries 1 cup water 1cup sugar. Blend in vitamix then heat on stove and stir until hot to bind sugars, don't boil. Bottle and refrigerate.

Add cognac, rye, Chartreuse and bitters to a mixing glass with ice, and stir until cold. Add splash of fernet to a rocks glass, roll the glass to coat the sides, and discard the excess. Add one large ice cube to the glass, strain the drink over the cube, and garnish with a mint sprig.
Add cubed ice to a highball, add 2 dashes of Angostura Bitters, top with ginger beer, garnish with a sprig of basil.

Add first three ingredients to a mixing glass with shaker and lightly shake with ice. Pour mixture into a Collins or highball glass over ice. Top with Mexican Coke (or any coca cola as a substitute) and pour Luxardo Fernet on top to float. Garnish with a lime wheel and fresh mint sprig.
Add gin, lemon juice, maraschino liqueur, and liqueur de violette to a collins glass filled with ice. Add tonic water; stir to combine. Garnish with a lemon wheel.
Add ingredients in a mixing glass with fresh ice. Shake vigorously strain over fresh ice. Garnish with lemon peel to fit in glass and 1 dash of Abbott's Aromatic Bitters. Optional sugar rim.
Add ingredients to a mixing glass except club soda. Shake over ice, strain over ice into a collins glass, top with club soda. Garnish with a lemon wedge and candied ginger on a pick.

Add ingredients to a mug and stir.

*Honey-Ginger Syrup:
Combine 1 part ginger with 2 parts honey and 1 cup of water and boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 5 mins. Strain and discard solids.

**Ghost-Pepper-Infused Campari:
Soak 1 ghost pepper in a 16 oz. bottle of Campari for up to 24 hrs (reduce infusion time to reduce heat).

***Cinnamon Tincture:
Soak 3 cinnamon sticks in 16 oz. of any neutral grain alcohol that is high proof (regular 80-proof vodka is great) for up to 14 days. Strain and discard the sticks.

Add Junipero Gin and botanicals first. Add ice and follow with a bold tonic. Top with additional botanicals/garnish for presentation.

*Assorted Complementing Botanicals: Orange, Star Anise, Rose Petals, Italian Juniper
Add pisco and lime juice into a highball glass filled with ice. Pour ginger ale into the glass to top. Add 2-3 drops of bitters. Garnish with lime wheel.
Add room temperature Creme de Cassis to the glass first, followed by the Champagne.
Add room temperature Creme de Cassis to the glass first, followed by the wine.
Add soda to bucket first, then add spirits and mixers. Top with ice and garnish.
Add spirits and bitters to collins glass. Add large ice cubes and fill with club soda. Garnish with orange peel (or lemon peel).
Add the Cherry Liqueur to a flute, top with Prosecco, and garnish with a Luxardo Maraschino Cherry.

Add the cucumber, mint and simple syrup to a mixing glass and muddle. Add everything else, then shake with ice and strain into a Collins glass filled with ice. Garnish with a mint sprig poking through a cucumber wheel.
Add vodka and lime juice to drinking glass, add ice, and top with ginger beer. Garnish with a lime.

Barrel aged for 5 months in a used bourbon barrel.

Stir with ice and strain into a small coupe. Garnish with an orange twist.

Barrel aged in a used bourbon barrel that previously held a cocktail containing Hine Cognac and Luxardo Bitter.

Stir with ice and strain into a small coupe. Garnish with an orange twist.
Blend with ice.

Boil water in a tea kettle. 

Squeeze lemon slice into the mug. Insert whole cloves into the lemon slice and drop it into the mug.

Brown sugar cube soaked in Peychaud’s Bitters. Put soaked sugar cube in glass first. Pour .75 oz Pink Pigeon rum into flute over sugar cube. Fill remainder of the glass with champagne. Garnish with lemon twist.
Build & Stir. Hoshizaki Ice.

Build all ingredients except for the Topo Chico in a wine glass. Fill the glass with cubed ice then top with Topo Chico by pouring it down a barspoon to incorporate. Zest the top with orange and place it in the glass. Add edible flowers for aroma and aesthetic.
Build all ingredients in a mixing glass, add ice and stir. Strain into a chilled martini glass and garnish with fresh fennel flowers.
Build all ingredients in a mixing glass. Stir with ice and strain into coupe. Garnish with grapefruit peel.
Build all ingredients in a punch bowl and add ice, stir gently. Garnish with seasonal fruit and citrus wheels.
Build all into highball. Fill with ice. Top with soda water. Place pineapple leaf vertically in the glass.
Build and pour in punch bowl over large ice block.
Build and serve in a champagne flute.
Build cocktail in glass, add ice and stir. Garnish with rose petal.
Build in a glass over ice. Add lemon wheels and strawberries. Finish with a splash of fresh lemon or top up with some sparkling wine. This drink can also be made in jugs or punch bowls.

Build in a large pitcher or punchbowl. Combine Pink Pigeon Rum, juice from 2 lemons and agave. Blend 7 oz. of fresh watermelon in a blender and puree to mixture. Add a generous amount of ice and stir. Top with ginger beer. Ladle or pour into coupe glasses.
Build in a mixing glass and add ice. Slowly pour back and forth between two tins, about 4-6 times. Then dump the whole cocktail into a Fizz or Collins glass.

Build in a mixing glass. Add ice. Stir to dilute. Strain into a Nick & Nora glass. Garnish with an orange twist.

*Clarified Milk:
-- 1 C Whole Milk
-- .5 oz Lemon Juice

Heat milk to just before a simmer, then add lemon juice. Lightly stir to break the solid from the whey. Let chill for 5 mins to allow the solids to properly separate. Coffee strain twice for clarity.

Build in an ice filled 14 oz beer glass, add BarSol Pisco, Ginger Liqueur, fresh lime juice, and agave nectar. Roll into a Boston shaker and shake to mix, place cranberry bitters on top, add ginger beer and garnish with a wedge of fresh lime.
Build in an old fashioned glass over ice. Garnish with orange peel.
Build in collins glass. Top with soda. Orange peel.
Build in glass. Add crushed ice and swizzle. Top with more crushed ice. Dash pepita tincture on top for aromatics. Garnish with lemon wheel and dried fig.
Build in ice-filled tall glass, garnish with a squeeze of lime.
Build in old fashioned glass over ice.
Build in old fashioned glass, stir and serve over large ice cube.
Build in rocks glass. Use cylinder ice cube.
Build over ice in Old Fashioned glass.
Build over ice, stir lightly, and garnish with a lime twist and a Luxardo Cherry.
Build over ice, stir lightly, and garnish with an orange peel or slice and Luxardo Cherry.
Build spirits in a tall glass over clear ice. Top with 4 oz tonic and garnish with a lemon twist curled into a flower if you're feeling fancy.
Build syrup and ice cream in a lowball cocktail glass, and top with soda water. Serve with a metal straw, a spoon, and garnish with a Luxardo Maraschino Cherry.
Build the cocktail in a mixing glass. Stir for about 15 seconds and then strain over ice into a old fashioned glass.
Build then pour into a pre-heated Irish coffee glass or mug. Top with hot water. Garnish with the orange slice and add a dash of Peychaud's Bitters.

Chill coupe glass and garnish rim by coating the outer lip of the glass with a wedge of lemon and dipping into a shallow dish containing superfine white sugar. Place lemon strip neatly along side of sugared coupe. Combine all liquid ingredients into shaker; add ice and shake. Double strain into glass.

Chill cup and place a napkin around it. In the base of the cup put everything except the cider and the raspberry syrup and give a brief stir. Add some crushed ice. Stir vigorously. Top with crushed ice. Add cider. Pour raspberry syrup on top. Garnish with cinnamon quill as a stirrer, some small flowers, and a lime wheel.
Chilled. Serve up or on the rocks.
Cold shake-strain into coupe and garnish with a Luxardo Maraschino Cherry.
Combine all ingredients and shake thoroughly without ice for several minutes. Add ice, shake, and strain into a tall collins glass. Top with soda and garnish with an orange wheel.
Combine all ingredients and stir with ice in a mixing glass. Strain into coupe glass and garnish with a Luxardo Cherry.
Combine all ingredients and stir. Pour the mixture into a chilled Nick & Nora glass and garnish with the orange zest.
Combine all ingredients besides beer and bitters and dry shake without ice. Add ice and re-shake, double strain into a fizz glass and top with beer. Garnish with shaved nutmeg and 3 drops of bitters.

Combine all ingredients besides blood orange into a mixing glass and stir until proper dilution (15-20 seconds). Pour into a small martini glass. Rub a thin slice of blood orange around the rim and place in drink.
Combine all ingredients except Duke's Lemon garnish in mixing glass and stir. Pour into a rocks glass and garnish. Ice does not touch this drink.

Combine all ingredients except for tonic. Shake with ice. Strain into a chilled coupe. Top with the tonic and garnish with a fresh grapefruit peel. 

*Substitute with Yellow Chartreuse Liqueur
Combine all ingredients except soda in a shaker with ice, shake to combine. Pour into a coupe glass and garnish with a lemon peel.
Combine all ingredients except soda in a shaker with ice, shake to combine. Pour over ice in a rocks glass and top with soda. Garnish with a Luxardo cherry.

Combine all ingredients except soda in a tin and dry shake. Add ice and shake vigorously. Add soda into a collins glass and slowly strain the drink over it until it forms a head. Garnish with one rhubarb stalk.

*Rhubarb Infused Gin:
750 ml of gin with 3 chopped stalks of fresh rhubarb for 48 hours
Combine all ingredients except sparkling wine in a shaker. Add ice and shake until chilled through. Double strain into a champagne flute and garnish with an orange twist.

Combine all ingredients except the bitters and dry shake. Add ice and shake again. Strain over fresh ice into a double old fashioned glass. Dash bitters over the top of the cocktail. Garnish with a dried peach and a piece of candied ginger.
Combine all ingredients in a chilled mixing glass, rimmed with sea salt and stir. Add ice. Stir again to mix. Garnish with a cocktail shrimp, lemon zest, fresh ground pepper and a celery stalk.
Combine all ingredients in a Collins glass and stir. Garnish with a slice of ginger and lemon wheel.
Combine all ingredients in a frozen mixing glass with hard ice and stir for 20 seconds. Strain into a frozen coupe glass.
Combine all ingredients in a glass filled with ice and garnish with an orange twist.
Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass and add ice. Shake well and double strain and serve into a coupe.
Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass and stir until proper dilution. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a sage leaf speared through two cocktail onions.
Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass with ice, stir and strain into a chilled cocktail glass. Garnish with a lemon twist and the edible flower of your choice.
Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass, add ice and stir. Strain into a chilled coupe glass and garnish with a Luxardo Maraschino Cherry.
Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass, add ice and then stir. Strain into a Nick & Nora glass and garnish with a lemon twist.

Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass, stir, and strain into a chilled Nick & Nora glass. Garnish with a picked cucumber ribbon.

*Nori-Infused Sake: 
-- Ginjo Sake
-- Nori Seaweed Sheet

Using an Oji Style Cold Brew Coffee Maker, drip Ginjo sake through a 0.5 gram of nori seaweed sheet that has been hand-shredded. It takes 3 hours to infuse a 750 ml bottle.
Combine all ingredients in a mixing glass. Stir until 2 oz water is diluted. Strain into a sherry or nosing glass. Flame and discard an orange peel. Drink deeply.

Combine all ingredients in a mixing tin. Shake and strain into a collins glass full of crushed ice. Garnish with apple slices.

*Chamomile Tea Syrup: 
-- 2 c water
-- 1 c chamomile flower
-- 1 c sugar
Bring 1 cup water to boil.
Add 1 cup chamomile flower and 1 more cup of water, bring back to a boil.
Add 1 cup sugar, bring to boil. 
Let it rest. When cool, the syrup is ready.
Combine all ingredients in a punch bowl, add a large chunk or block of ice, garnish with lemon wheels and apple slices. Serve when punch is chilled.

Combine all ingredients in a shaker and shake until proper dilution. Double strain into a chilled martini or coupe glass and garnish with 2 fresh basil leaves that have been lightly "spanked" to release aromatics.
Combine all ingredients in a shaker tin and shake vigorously. Double strain using a fine mesh strainer. Serve in a lager glass over ice.
Combine all ingredients in a shaker tin and shake vigorously. Double strain with a fine mesh strainer into a highball glass.
Combine all ingredients in a shaker tin filled with crushed ice. Flash-shake and dump into a double old fashioned glass. Garnish.
Combine all ingredients in a shaker tin, add ice, and shake vigorously. Double strain with a fine mesh strainer into a highball glass.
Combine all ingredients in a shaker, except the apple cider. Shake vigorously. Strain over ice. Top with apple cider. Garnish with shaved cinnamon and nutmeg.
Combine all ingredients in a shaking tin and give it a short shake, five seconds. Strain into an old fashined glass with three medium sized ice cubes.

Combine all ingredients in a shaking tin or mixing glass and vigorously shake without ice for 10 seconds. Add ice, and shake for another 8 seconds. Strain over larger ice cube or into a cocktail glass and add freshly grated cinnamon on top.

*Vanilla Syrup: 
Split 1 vanilla pod lengthwise and scrape interior into a heavy sauce pan. 
Add 2 c. raw sugar and 2 c. water. Bring to a simmer and reduce heat to low. 
Cook for 5 mins and stir occasionally. 
Remove from heat and keep unstrained for 24 hrs. 
Strain through a cheese cloth and bottle. Keeps for 2 weeks.

**Coconut Cream:
Combine 1 part Coco Lopez with 1 part rich coconut milk. Mix well.
Combine all ingredients in a sparkling wine glass.
Combine all ingredients in a tall glass.

Combine all ingredients in a wine glass, stir to mix. Add ice and enjoy.  
Convert ounces to cups to make a larger pitcher for you and your guests.
Combine all ingredients in mixing glass with ice and stir. Strain into chilled cocktail coupe or Nick & Nora. Expel lemon peel over cocktail then place in glass.

Combine all ingredients in mixing glass. Stir and strain into Nick & Nora cocktail glass. Garnish with lemon zest and yerba mate tea sachet.

*Bay Leaf Syrup:
-- 16 oz Water
-- 12 Bay Leaves
-- 1.5 C White Sugar

Bring water to boil with bay leaves. Lower heat to medium and simmer 15-20 mins. Stir in white sugar until dissolved, without bringing to a boil again. Remove from heat, let cool at room temperature. Remove bay leaves and enjoy.

**Salt Tincture:
-- .5 C Salt
-- 1 C Water
-- 2 C 100p Vodka

Stir salt with water and vodka. Stir until dissolved. Strain out extra salt, if any.

Combine all ingredients in Perlini sparkling cocktail shaker, shake and double strain into cocktail glass. (For home use, combine all ingredients, add ice shake 30 seconds and double strain into coupe, add splash of soda water.)
Spray with atomized Old Tom Gin.
Garnish with cucumber peel or candied rhubarb slice.

*Rhubarb Cucumber & Mint-Infused Junipero Gin:
-- 1 bottle Junipero Gin
-- 1 qt Chopped Rhubarb
-- 1 Chopped Large English Cucumber
-- .5 Bunch (15g) Fresh Mint (with stems)

Combine all ingredients in vacuum sealed bag and circulate at 53º for 2 hours. (For home use, combine all ingredients in plastic container and let rest for one week.)

*Rhubarb Syrup:
Juice 1 qt (8-10 Stalks)
Add to 1 qt of unbleached Cane sugar in saucepan and bring to simmer.
Remove from heat, allow to cool and strain in Chinoise.
Combine all ingredients in shaker. Dry shake for 10 seconds, add ice and shake for 30 seconds. Strain into small tumbler. Garnish with a sprinkle of grated nutmeg.

Combine all ingredients in to a mixing glass and add ice.

Stir for about 10-15 seconds.

Strain in to a cocktail coupe or a glass of your choosing.

Garnish with an orange twist expressed over the top of the drink.
Combine all ingredients into a large punch bowl and add large ice cube/cubes. Garnish liberally with slice fruits.
Combine all ingredients into a mixing glass and add ice. Shake and strain into a martini glass. Garnish with an olive.

Combine all ingredients into a mixing glass and add ice. Stir for about 10 seconds and then strain into a chilled cocktail coupe. Garnish with skewered apple spheres and be thankful you're having a cocktail, and not having an apple shot off your head.
Combine all ingredients into a mixing glass and add ice. Stir until proper dilution and strain into a chilled coupe. Garnish with an orange peel.
Combine all ingredients into a mixing glass and stir until proper dilution. Strain into a chilled bucket glass over a large ice cube and garnish with a dukes lemon and dukes grapefruit zest.
Combine all ingredients into mixing glass. Add ice. Stir until very cold. Strain and fine strain to prevent ice chips in coupe glass. Garnish with orange twist entwined around a cinnamon stick.
Combine all ingredients with ice, shake, strain into martini glass, top with prosecco, garnish with sage.

Combine all ingredients, add ice, and shake. Double strain into an old fashioned glass and add fresh ice. Garnish with an orange slice (1/4 wheel) and Luxardo Cherry (both speared).

*0.25 - 0.50 oz Cane Sugar Syrup (to taste to allow variations in citrus flavor when batching)
Combine all ingredients, minus the sparkling wine, into a tin. Shake and double strain into a flute glass. Top with a float of sparkling wine. Garnish with an edible flower petal.
Combine all ingredients, shake for 20 seconds. Add ice and shake again. Strain into a snifter. Garnish with shaved nutmeg.
Combine all ingredients. Shake and strain into cocktail glass. Garnish with an orange peel.

Combine all liquid ingredients in a chilled mixing glass with cracked ice and stir for 20 seconds.
Double strain the cocktail over a large cube placed in an old-fashioned glass.
Garnish with a lemon twist making sure to release all the essential oils out of the twist. Also make sure to rub the entire rim of the glass with the twist before dropping it into the cocktail.

Combine all liquid ingredients in a highball or Collins glass with ice.
Stir lightly and garnish with a lemon twist making sure to release all the essential oils out of the twist. Also make sure to rub the entire rim of the glass with the twist before dropping it into the cocktail.

Combine all liquids with exception of sodas, sir together. Strain into collins glass with singular large cube. Top with sodas. Garnish with sliver of poached pear from syrup (kept chilled).

*Rose Poached Pear Syrup:
-- 1.5 C Rose (La Vielle Ferme or similar)
-- 1.5 C Water 
-- 2 C Sugar
-- 1 Large Lemon
-- 1 Half Orange
-- 1 tsp Ground Ginger (not fresh)
-- 1 tsp Vanilla
-- 3-5 Whole Cloves

Combine Rose (La Vielle Ferme or similar), water, and sugar. Bring to a simmer. Add zest of lemon and an orange, ground ginger, vanilla, and cloves. Peel and halve pears, set gently into liquid. Keep just under a simmer for 15 mins. Remove from heat, let cool at least 20 mins. Pears will keep for 3 days refrigerated in syrup. The syrup itself will last longer.

Combine all the ingredients except Prosecco. Add a large block of ice or large ice cubes and stir. Top with Prosecco. Garnish with orange wheels studded with cloves and float some mint sprigs in the bowl.

Combine all the ingredients in a mixing glass and stir for about 10 seconds. Strain in to an Old Fashioned glass or glass of your choosing. Add large ice cubes. Garnish with a lemon wheel, mint sprigs and a blackberry.

*Moroccan Mint Tea (Numi Tea Brand):
-- 1 Moroccan Mint Tea Bag
-- 8 oz. Boiling Water
 
Combine the tea bag and the boiling water in a cup or a pot. Let steep for 5 minutes. Remove the tea bag and place the tea in the fridge to cool. Label and date the container. Will keep for 1 week.

**Rich Honey Syrup:
-- 10 oz. Honey
-- 5 oz. Hot Water

Combine both ingredients together in a container and stir until fully incorporated. Label and date the container. Will keep in the fridge for 2 weeks.
Combine all the ingredients in an old-fashioned glass. Stir on the rocks. Garnish with lemon peel.

Combine bourbon, lemon juice, and syrup in a shaker and add cold ice. Shake until chilled well (10-30 sec. depending on the quality of the ice). Strain into a collins glass and slowly pour the vermouth into the glass. Garnish with a lemon twist. 

*Orange-scented Maple Syrup:
combine 6 oz. of grade B maple syrup, 6 oz. filtered water and the peel of 1 orange, with a minimum amount of pith in a non-reactive pan. 
Simmer for 10 mins. Remove from heat and allow it to cool to room temp. before using. 
Syrup will keep for 1 month if refrigerated.

Combine Gin, Maraschino, juices, and bitters in an ice-filled mixing tin and shake for 20-30 seconds, or until well chilled. Strain over fresh ice into a Collins glass, top with the California Lager, and garnish with the grapefruit peel.

Combine H by HINE, King's Ginger Liqueur, and bitters over ice in a mixing glass. Stir until you reach proper dilution(15-20 seconds). Strain over a large ice rock in a bucket glass and garnish with Luxardo Cherries.
Combine Hophead Vodka, Kings Ginger, and lime juice in a Collins glass and fill with ice. Top with ginger beer. Stir. Garnish with a lime wheel.
Combine Hophead, lemon juice, Giffard Pamplemousse, honey syrup, and bitters in a shaker. Add ice and shake vigorously. Strain into a chilled glass. Fill the glass with beer.

Combine Hophead, lemon juice, King's Ginger, honey syrup, egg white, and bitters in a shaker and dry shake to emulsify egg whites. Add ice and shake vigorously until proper dilution.
